summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from June 2020 regarding a request to contact a 'Touhy contact' within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). The emails involve an attorney (S. Esq.) and a representative from the U.S. Attorney's Office, discussing expedited communication and confidentiality.

persons.name: S. Esq.
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, requesting to be put in touch with a 'Touhy contact' and emphasizing urgency and confidentiality.

events.title: Email follow-up from USANYS
events.description: A representative from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) responds to an attorney's inquiry, stating they have contacted the point person in their Civil Division and expect a response soon.

events.title: Urgent request for Touhy contact
events.description: Attorney S. Esq. sends an urgent email requesting to be put in touch with the 'Touhy contact' at the U.S. Attorney's Office, noting that time is of the essence.

keyFacts: The correspondence involves a request to contact a 'Touhy contact' at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), referencing the Touhy regulations which govern how federal employees respond to subpoenas.
The attorney, S. Esq., expresses urgency, stating 'Time is becoming of the essence here,' indicating time-sensitive legal matters.
The emails contain standard legal confidentiality notices, emphasizing attorney-client privilege and the protection of confidential information.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), indicating it is part of sealed or restricted litigation.
